subject: Re: [junit] Query regarding Regarding Mock Objects
msgSnippet: ... You don t need a mock for ActionMapping. Just use it. The difference is that you re not loading its data from struts-config.xml; you re just setting its
messageBody:
Chanduram wrote:

> public void testfailedLogin(){
> MockHttpServletRequest mockrequest = new MockHttpServletRequest();
> mockrequest.setupAddParameter("usrId", "chandu1");
> mockrequest.setupAddParameter("pwd", "password1");
> ActionMapping maping = new ActionMapping() ; // Is this rite and how
> can I create a Mock for ActionMapping.

You don't need a mock for ActionMapping. Just use it. The difference is
that you're not loading its data from struts-config.xml; you're just
setting its data by invoking methods directly on it.

I recommend using EasyMock/jMock instead. You fake out the data by
saying "when someone invokes request.getParameter('userId'), return
'chandu1'" and so on. It's merely a different style of writing the same
thing as the MockObjects library. I found the MO library a little
difficult to understand.

By the way....

> private String usrId = null;

Why on Earth would you abbreviate "userId" to "usrId"?!?! To save typing
ONE CHARACTER?!?! Wow.
--
